info.description:
The Avetta API is a mechanism to allow our customers to retrieve Audit and Supplier data from Connect via application programming interface. The Avetta API is organized around REST and uses HTTP status codes and error payload responses to indicate API errors. We leverage the HTTP protocol features, like HTTP verbs and status codes, which are commonly used and are understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients. All API responses (including errors) will be returned in JSON format. #### Versioning You will notice in this documentation that the URL for this API is as follows: https://api.avetta.com/client-api/vX.... This URL contains `vX` to specify the particular version to be used when making the desired call. Different versions of the same endpoint may return different results, therefore it is important to note the versions of each endpoint in this documentation. Please be aware of this as you check each endpoint. #### Authentication When using the API, include your secret API key in the request for the service to authenticate your account. This API Key will be provided to you by your point of contact in Avetta. All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls to the service over HTTP will result in a 302 Redirect response to the HTTPS end-point. API requests without an apikey will fail. #### Errors Avetta uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the 2xx range indicate success, codes in the 4xx range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, an invalid account number, validation failure, etc.), and in rare situations, codes in the 5xx range indicate a server error. #### Examples To Follow How to call Suppliers to view Compliance for all suppliers?
/v1/suppliers?apikey
How to call Flags?
/v1/flags?apikey=key&flagTye=Green
How to call Forms?
v1/forms?apikey=key&formName=&supplierId=250&questionId=15139
Should I use Audit or Forms?
Forms if a better choice fro specific queries. If you need to pull all forms using Audit do not call this endpoint more than 1 time per day as this has a performance impact on the system.
#### Pagination Avetta has a default maximum limit of 500 results in one API call, configurable up to a maximum of 3000 via the `limit` parameter. In the case where the `count` endpoint returns a response more than the default limit, you must utilize pagination to retrieve the full data set. Avetta utilizes cursor-based pagination via optional start and limit query string parameters. The `start` parameter indicates the record to start with for pagination and the `limit` parameter indicates the total number of records to return. Consider the following scenario: Step 1: Retrieve total number of records from the supplier count endpoint. The supplier count endpoint returns 6450 records. Since this record is greater than the default number of records returned of 500, pagination must be used to retrieve all the records from the count result. A possible approach to this would be Step 2: Call the supplier endpoint with `start=1&limit=3000` [This will return the records 1-3000] Step 3: Call the supplier endpoint with `start=3001&limit=3000` [This will return the records 3001-6000] Step 4: Call the supplier endpoint with `start=6001&limit=3000` [This will return the next 3000 records, which in this case will only be the remaining 450 records (6001 - 6450] #### Modified Records An optional parameter available for both supplier and audit endpoints is the `modifiedAfter` field. This query string parameter takes in a string with the following format: `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` using Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This will return records that have been modified after the specified date and time. In the event that only a date, `yyyy-MM-dd`, is received the system will default the time to `00:00:00` UTC. #### Error Handling Our errors are listed below in the following format -> Code Error Number [Actual Message]: Description of the error. * Code 1 [Validation Failed]: An invalid API key was provided. * Code 2 [Invalid Parameters]: The start and/or limit parameters entered are not within acceptable limits. * Code 3 [Unknown Record]: The entered start parameter is beyond the total number of records available. * Code 4 [Unmapped]: Client ID that is entered is not mapped on the custom DB tables. * Code 5 [Server Error]: The system has encountered an unexpected error while processing the request. * Code 6 [ConID Error]: The requested supplier ID is unknown under the current API key. * Code 7 [Null Data]: No audit or flag data available. * Code 8 [Invalid Format]: Provided date and time does not conform to the `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` or `yyyy-MM-dd` formats. * Code 9 [Unknown file type]: Internal Server Error.

get.description:
Return the binary file. The response content type header is set to be a PDF as an example, but other file types can be returned such as text, or doc/docx.
The URL for this endpoint is returned by the `href` field from the `Form Data` endpoint. That `href` field will require an additional `&apikey=INSERT_API_KEY_HERE` to be appended to the end of the URL for a valid file call to be made.

parameters.description: Optional parameter. The `modifiedAfter` parameter will filter out any records with updated_date values older than the value of the parameter supplied. Please note: updated_date does NOT keep track of the last time one of the fields in the payload has changed. In fact, it keeps track of the last change anywhere in the entire supplier model (an internal model, of which only certain fields are exposed in this endpoint). This, while not very intuitive, means that a possible scenario includes pulling data which has a very recent date in modifiedAfter, despite there not having been any other visible changes to the model in quite some time. Changes that can result in updating this updated_date value include changes made by the supplier, changes made by the client (e.g. applying or removing tags), and also some changes made by the system, including recalculating forms and flags.
parameters.name: modifiedAfter

parameters.description: Optional value to indicate the connection status of the supplier
parameters.name: status

get.description:
Retrieves a list of multiple supplier data. By default, only suppliers that have active connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint.

* The `flags` array contains the suppliers flag for a particular `client_id`. 
* The `client_id` field is the identifier of a specific site within your account hierarchy. 
* The `system_flag` field shows the overall flag color for a particular supplier/contractor for that `client_id`.
* The `system_flag_details` array contains the detail of your individual flaggable data and its current flag color. This provides specific detailed reasons for the current overall flag color, `system_flag` for in regards to that specific `client_id`.

parameters.description: The apikey for the client
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: Optional value to return amount of modified records since the specified date and time
parameters.name: modifiedAfter

parameters.description: Optional value to indicate the connection status of the supplier
parameters.name: status

get.description: Retrieves information about the provided supplier ignoring `start`, `limit`, and `modifiedAfter` parameters.

Retrieves a list of criteria flag data based on the provided apikey. The `flagDetails` object contains information relevant to the type of flag returned. For example, a `flagType` of `account` will have no `formId` or `questionId` values (will default to `""`) since an account level flag does not relate to a specific form/question. Likewise a `flagType` of `question` will have both `formId` and `questionId` populated as a question level flag pertains to a specific question in a specific form.

Only active suppliers that have approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint. 

This endpoint does not retrieve the overall flag status between a supplier and a client, which will be returned in the "Connections" endpoint.

get.description: Gets the applicable statuses to apply for a specific form. The list of statuses would be the applicable status to set based on the current status of the form. If the form is in its final workflow status, then it will return an empty list.

message.description: message is empty when the form is actionable showing the list of applicable actions, otherwise it will show the reason why it is not and will show an empty list of applicable actions.

application/json.message: formId is not in a valid numeric format.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: The apikey for the client

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The numeric id of the form. Should be in a numeric format.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The target language of the applicable statuses

post.description:
Access to the approval process of specific forms that are not yet in their final workflow status. In case of failure, the form remains unchanged.
Max field lengths on String fields will be strictly enforced, and requests that exceed the maximum field length will result in a validation failure.
Action field will be validated to only allow applicable status that can be applied on the form.

application/json.message: The form is in a worfklow state that is no longer actionable.

parameters.name: apikey
parameters.description: The apikey for the client

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The numeric id of the form to approve/reject. Should be in a numeric format.

parameters.name: Approval Form

action.description: The value should be one of the applicable actions (Refer to the previous endpoint)

lang.description: The language of the action specified. Optional

parameters.description: The type of approval for the form.

get.description:
Updated version of the `Audit` endpoint which uses updated nomenclature and includes the applicable client sites a particular form is valid for.

Retrieves a set of `Form` data based on the provided request/pagination parameters. 
The `href` field in the schema below will only return for `Form` data where the question requires a file upload as an answer. 
Only active suppliers that have approved connections to clients will be returned in this endpoint.

get.description: Returns the total number of records from the `Form` Endpoint. All query parameters from the `Form` endpoint are also applicable in this endpoint as those values will be used in determining the number of records given the provided parameters.

tags.description:
Our errors are listed below in the following format -> Code Error Number [Actual Message]: Description of the error.

Code 1 [Validation Failed]: An invalid API key was provided.

Code 2 [Invalid Parameters]: The start and/or limit parameters entered are not within acceptable limits.

Code 3 [Unknown Record]: The entered start parameter is beyond the total number of records available.

Code 4 [Unmapped]: Client ID that is entered is not mapped on the custom DB tables.

Code 5 [Server Error]: The system has encountered an unexpected error while processing the request.

Code 6 [ConID Error]: The requested supplier ID is unknown under the current API key.

Code 7 [Null Data]: No audit or flag data available.

Code 8 [Invalid Format]: Provided date and time does not conform to the `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss` or `yyyy-MM-dd` formats

Code 9 [Unknown file type]: Internal Server Error
tags.name: Error Handling
